review: Overall I think it is good product. For the price point it is a pretty good value.Setup: It is fairly simple to setup. it needs a USB power so it needs to be plugged in USB slot on TV or power cord provided.Positives: small form factor. Easily hides behind or to side to TV.There are a lot of apps it works with like Netflix and YouTube for Apple iOS or android.Negatives: does not work with Amazon prime which is unfortunate especially for prime members. not surprising since Amazon has entered the marketplace with very similar product. It does not work with HBO now but HBO has said it will in near future.It lacks some of the bells and whistles of  Roku , Apple TV or Fire stick but it is good value for money.
author: Sean C.

review: The chromecast has become a staple in my living room. I have also converted my parents living room to revolve around their chromecast. I use my Nexus 7 tablet (any phone / tablet / computer will cast) to essentially turn my television into a smart tv via the chromecast. It is extremely easy to set up and has been fairly reliable for me (the most you'll have to do is reset it if something goes wrong). I have experience in software development and I am a Google fanboy. They are working toward a very convenient, very responsive, and very affordable "Google ecosystem" that I use across all my devices. This is a great addition to your home, even if you never use Google products. My sister can cast from her iPhone and as they develop their software, it will be easier and easier to use. The device now supports "guest mode" which is really nice for entertaining.
author: Adamm Hockman
